alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 7:40PM CDT until June 02 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Conecuh, Covington and Escambia. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 737 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall over the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks, streams, local roadways, and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dixie, Brooklyn, Damascus, Rome, Roberts and Beck. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
